result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on November 10, 2022 at 08:45 am.
granting motion to withdraw as counsel

9:06 AM Defendant Herbert E. Clause Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Herbert E. Clause Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jolin indicates there is now a conflict and counsel will be found within PD Office. State in agreement. Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 8:44 AM Defendant Herbert E. Clause Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Herbert E. Clause Jr.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin.  Calling case 21CT52 and 22CF110. ADA Brown pleas statement on 21CT52 moves to dismiss Ct 2 and 3, Judge granted. Defendant pleas NC to Ct 1. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty. Sentence on 21CT52 sentence imposed and stayed, 75 days jail, 2 year probation conditions fine $1870 plus cost, AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 27 month drivers license revocation, 27 month IID, 25 days conditional jail with 4 days credit and good time credit. Payment due within 60 days to Vilas COCC. Defendant advised of appeal rights.

9:53 AM Defendant Herbert E. Clause Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Herbert E. Clause Jr.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of complaint. Bond continued.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license, Not to possess or consume intoxicants.

1:35 PM Defendant Herbert E. Clause Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shawl present in the courtroom on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Defendant confirms receipt of criminal complaint. Court reads charges. Defendant has not contacted public defender yet. Right to counsel.  Judge Milanowski explains conflict and requests Clerk to complete application for judicial assignment.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 CASH with conditions: No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license, Not to possess or consume intoxicants.  Bond form.
Initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
